sodukusolver

Class SodukuSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • sodukusolver.SodukuSolver

  • public class SodukuSolver
extends java.lang.Object
    An automated process for solving a Sudoku puzzle of any size square grid using a backtracking algorithm.
    Author:
    Sam Henley

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int[][] grid
      Current state of the puzzle grid
      private int size

    • Constructor Detail

      • SodukuSolver

        public SodukuSolver(int[][] grid)
        Initializes data fields and ensures the input grid is a valid Sudoku puzzle grid. A Sudoku puzzle grid is valid if: A) the lengths of all sides are equal, and B) All numbers in the grid are 0 < m < s, where m is a number, and s is the length of on side of the grid (0's represent unassigned values).
        Parameters:
        grid - the Sudoku puzzle to solve

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Initiates solving of puzzle

      • solve

        private boolean solve()
        Recursively solves the puzzle by checking if a certain value is valid in a square, then continues to solve assuming that value is correct. A value is valid if that value is not present in that square's row, column, or box (the box is sqrt(size), e.g. in a 9x9 puzzle, the box is 3x3). If the value turns out to be invalid, the next possible value is stored and solving continues.
        Returns:
        true if the solve was successful, false otherwise

      • isSafe

        private boolean isSafe(int r,
                       int c,
                       int trial)
        Tests if a value is valid in a certain square. See solve() for the definition of valid.
        Parameters:
        r - the row of the square to check
        c - the column of a square to check
        trial - the value to try
        Returns:
        true if the value is valid, false otherwise

      • findUnassignedCell

        private int[] findUnassignedCell()
        Searches the grid for an unassigned value (if the value of the square == 0)
        Returns:
        [row, column] of an unassigned square

      • printGrid

        private void printGrid()
        Prints the grid to the console.

      • finished

        private void finished()
        Runs when the algorithm has finished solving the puzzle.

        Driver method where the grid is input and the solver is started.
